required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Open Label Safety and Efficacy Study of Levetiracetam in Patients With Epilepsy
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase IV, Open-label, Multi-center, Community-based Trial in Asia Studying the Safety and Efficacy of Keppraâ„¢ as Adjunctive Therapy in Adult Subjects With Uncontrolled Partial Epilepsy.

brief_summary.textblock:
Community based study assessing safety and efficacy of levetiracetam in partial onset seizures.
The optimal dose in daily clinical practice will be used.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Adverse Events (AEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline until Safety visit (two weeks after last dose; up to Week 18)
primary_outcome.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a patient or clinical investigation subject administered a pharmaceutical product that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change From Historical Baseline in Partial (Type I) Seizure Frequency Per Week Over the Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage change from baseline in partial (Type I) seizure frequency over the treatment period standardized to 1 week period. Type I Partial (focal, local) seizure frequency per week will be derived from the seizure count information recorded on the daily record card (e.g. date, number, type of epileptic seizures) and is defined as the number of seizures standardized to a 1 week period. A negative value in percent change from historical baseline indicates a decrease in partial (type I) seizure frequency from historical baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change From Historical Baseline in Total (Type I+II+III) Seizure Frequency Per Week Over the Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage change from baseline in total (type I+II+III) seizure frequency over the treatment period standardized to 1 week period. Types I+II+III seizure frequency (Type I: Partial (focal, local), Type II: Generalized (convulsive or non-convulsive), Type III: Unclassified) per week will be derived from the seizure count information recorded on the daily record card (e.g. date, number, type of epileptic seizures) and is defined as the number of seizures standardized to a 1 week period. A negative value in percent change from historical baseline indicates a decrease in total (type I+II+III) seizure frequency from historical baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With 50% Response in Seizure Frequency Per Week at Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: 50% response in seizure frequency per Week is defined as >=50% reduction in seizure frequency from Baseline. Types I+II+III seizure frequency (Type I: Partial (focal, local), Type II: Generalized (convulsive or non-convulsive), Type III: Unclassified) per week will be derived from the seizure count information recorded on the daily record card (e.g. date, number, type of epileptic seizures) and is defined as the number of seizures standardized to a 1 week period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With 100% Response in Seizure Frequency Per Week at Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: 100% response in seizure frequency per Week is defined as 100% reduction in seizure frequency from Baseline. Types I+II+III seizure frequency (Type I: Partial (focal, local), Type II: Generalized (convulsive or non-convulsive), Type III: Unclassified) per week will be derived from the seizure count information recorded on the daily record card (e.g. date, number, type of epileptic seizures) and is defined as the number of seizures standardized to a 1 week period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Categorized Change From Baseline in Severity of Illness
secondary_outcome.description: The overall change in the severity of the subject's illness, compared to the subject's condition prior to the levetiracetam intake, was assessed by the Investigator using Investigator's Global Evaluation Scale (IGS). Categories are as following: Marked improvement; Moderate improvement; Slight improvement; No change; Slight worsening; Moderate worsening; Marked worsening.
Retention rate, defined as the number of subjects who were still on levetiracetam at Visit 5 (Week 16) or on the day before divided by the number of subjects in the ITT population.

intervention.description: Pharmaceutical form: oral tablets Concentration: 500 mg Route of administration: Oral use

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with epilepsy experiencing partial seizures, whether or not secondarily generalized.
- Subjects must present between 3 and 42 partial seizures over the three months prior to protocol Visit 1.
- Use of one (1), but no more than two (2) concomitant marketed antiepileptic drugs (AEDs) at the time of trial entry.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects on vigabatrin, whose visual field has not been assessed as per recommendation of the manufacturer, i.e. every 6 months.
- Presence of known pseudoseizures within the last year.
- Presence of progressive cerebral disease, any other progressively degenerative neurological disease, or any cerebral tumors.
- Uncountable seizures (clusters) or history of convulsive status epilepticus within the last five years.

results_reference.citation: Kwan P, Lim SH, Chinvarun Y, Cabral-Lim L, Aziz ZA, Lo YK, Tonner F, Beh K, Edrich P; N01036 (SKATE II) Investigator Group. Efficacy and safety of levetiracetam as adjunctive therapy in adult patients with uncontrolled partial epilepsy: the Asia SKATE II Study. Epilepsy Behav. 2010 May;18(1-2):100-5. doi: 10.1016/j.yebeh.2010.03.016. Epub 2010 May 11.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study started to enroll patients in November 2003 and concluded in May 2006.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participant Flow refers to the Intend-to-treat (ITT) Set.

baseline.population: Baseline characteristics refer to the Intend-to-treat (ITT) Set.

outcome.title: Number of Patients With Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a patient or clinical investigation subject administered a pharmaceutical product that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment.
outcome.time_frame: From Baseline until Safety visit (two weeks after last dose; up to Week 18)

measure.title: Number of Patients With Adverse Events (AEs)
measure.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a patient or clinical investigation subject administered a pharmaceutical product that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment.

outcome.title: Percentage Change From Historical Baseline in Partial (Type I) Seizure Frequency Per Week Over the Treatment Period
outcome.description: Percentage change from baseline in partial (Type I) seizure frequency over the treatment period standardized to 1 week period. Type I Partial (focal, local) seizure frequency per week will be derived from the seizure count information recorded on the daily record card (e.g. date, number, type of epileptic seizures) and is defined as the number of seizures standardized to a 1 week period. A negative value in percent change from historical baseline indicates a decrease in partial (type I) seizure frequency from historical baseline.
outcome.population: Only subjects with partial (Type I) seizure frequency per week at baseline >= 0 and non-missing values on treatment period are included in the analysis. Subjects withdrawing from the study are included up to their early discontinuation visit.

measure.title: Percentage Change From Historical Baseline in Partial (Type I) Seizure Frequency Per Week Over the Treatment Period
measure.description: Percentage change from baseline in partial (Type I) seizure frequency over the treatment period standardized to 1 week period. Type I Partial (focal, local) seizure frequency per week will be derived from the seizure count information recorded on the daily record card (e.g. date, number, type of epileptic seizures) and is defined as the number of seizures standardized to a 1 week period. A negative value in percent change from historical baseline indicates a decrease in partial (type I) seizure frequency from historical baseline.
measure.population: Only subjects with partial (Type I) seizure frequency per week at baseline >= 0 and non-missing values on treatment period are included in the analysis. Subjects withdrawing from the study are included up to their early discontinuation visit.

outcome.title: Percentage Change From Historical Baseline in Total (Type I+II+III) Seizure Frequency Per Week Over the Treatment Period
outcome.description: Percentage change from baseline in total (type I+II+III) seizure frequency over the treatment period standardized to 1 week period. Types I+II+III seizure frequency (Type I: Partial (focal, local), Type II: Generalized (convulsive or non-convulsive), Type III: Unclassified) per week will be derived from the seizure count information recorded on the daily record card (e.g. date, number, type of epileptic seizures) and is defined as the number of seizures standardized to a 1 week period. A negative value in percent change from historical baseline indicates a decrease in total (type I+II+III) seizure frequency from historical baseline.
outcome.population: Only subjects with total (Type I+II+III) seizure frequency per week at baseline >= 0 and non-missing values on treatment period are included in the analysis. Subjects withdrawing from the study are included up to their early discontinuation visit.

measure.title: Percentage Change From Historical Baseline in Total (Type I+II+III) Seizure Frequency Per Week Over the Treatment Period
measure.description: Percentage change from baseline in total (type I+II+III) seizure frequency over the treatment period standardized to 1 week period. Types I+II+III seizure frequency (Type I: Partial (focal, local), Type II: Generalized (convulsive or non-convulsive), Type III: Unclassified) per week will be derived from the seizure count information recorded on the daily record card (e.g. date, number, type of epileptic seizures) and is defined as the number of seizures standardized to a 1 week period. A negative value in percent change from historical baseline indicates a decrease in total (type I+II+III) seizure frequency from historical baseline.
measure.population: Only subjects with total (Type I+II+III) seizure frequency per week at baseline >= 0 and non-missing values on treatment period are included in the analysis. Subjects withdrawing from the study are included up to their early discontinuation visit.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With 50% Response in Seizure Frequency Per Week at Week 16
outcome.description: 50% response in seizure frequency per Week is defined as >=50% reduction in seizure frequency from Baseline. Types I+II+III seizure frequency (Type I: Partial (focal, local), Type II: Generalized (convulsive or non-convulsive), Type III: Unclassified) per week will be derived from the seizure count information recorded on the daily record card (e.g. date, number, type of epileptic seizures) and is defined as the number of seizures standardized to a 1 week period.
outcome.population: Only subjects with seizure frequency per week at baseline >= 0 and non-missing values on treatment period are taken into account for the responder rates. By convention, subjects with frequency per week at baseline equal to zero were considered as non-responder.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With 50% Response in Seizure Frequency Per Week at Week 16
measure.description: 50% response in seizure frequency per Week is defined as >=50% reduction in seizure frequency from Baseline. measure.population: Only subjects with seizure frequency per week at baseline >= 0 and non-missing values on treatment period are taken into account for the responder rates. By convention, subjects with frequency per week at baseline equal to zero were considered as non-responder.

outcome.population: Only subjects with seizure frequency per week at baseline >= 0 and non-missing values on treatment period are taken into account for the responder rates. By convention, subjects with frequency per week at baseline equal to zero were considered as non-responder.

measure.description: 100% response in seizure frequency per Week is defined as 100% reduction in seizure frequency from Baseline. Types I+II+III seizure frequency (Type I: Partial (focal, local), Type II: Generalized (convulsive or non-convulsive), Type III: Unclassified) per week will be derived from the seizure count information recorded on the daily record card (e.g. date, number, type of epileptic seizures) and is defined as the number of seizures standardized to a 1 week period.
measure.population: Only subjects with seizure frequency per week at baseline >= 0 and non-missing values on treatment period are taken into account for the responder rates. By convention, subjects with frequency per week at baseline equal to zero were considered as non-responder.

outcome.title: Percentage of Patients With Categorized Change From Baseline in Severity of Illness
outcome.description: The overall change in the severity of the subject's illness, compared to the subject's condition prior to the levetiracetam intake, was assessed by the Investigator using Investigator's Global Evaluation Scale (IGS). Categories are as following: Marked improvement; Moderate improvement; Slight improvement; No change; Slight worsening; Moderate worsening; Marked worsening.

measure.title: Percentage of Patients With Categorized Change From Baseline in Severity of Illness
measure.description: The overall change in the severity of the subject's illness, compared to the subject's condition prior to the levetiracetam intake, was assessed by the Investigator using Investigator's Global Evaluation Scale (IGS). Categories are as following: Marked improvement; Moderate improvement; Slight improvement; No change; Slight worsening; Moderate worsening; Marked worsening.

outcome.title: Retention Rate at Week 16
outcome.description: Retention rate, defined as the number of subjects who were still on levetiracetam at Visit 5 (Week 16) or on the day before divided by the number of subjects in the ITT population.

measure.title: Retention Rate at Week 16
measure.description: Retention rate, defined as the number of subjects who were still on levetiracetam at Visit 5 (Week 16) or on the day before divided by the number of subjects in the ITT population.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected from Visit 2 (week 2) until Safety Visit (up to 2 weeks after the last dose, up to 16 weeks).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
